52#ifdef KRB5
53#include <krb5.h>
54
55extern ServerOptions options;
56
57static int
58krb5_init(void *context)
59{
60 Authctxt *authctxt = (Authctxt *)context;
61 krb5_error_code problem;
62
63 if (authctxt->krb5_ctx == NULL) {
64 problem = krb5_init_context(&authctxt->krb5_ctx);
65 if (problem)
66 return (problem);
67 krb5_init_ets(authctxt->krb5_ctx);
68 }
69 return (0);
70}
71
72/*
73 * Try krb5 authentication. server_user is passed for logging purposes
74 * only, in auth is received ticket, in client is returned principal
75 * from the ticket
76 */
77int
78auth_krb5(struct ssh *ssh, krb5_data *auth, char **client, krb5_data *reply)
79{
80 krb5_error_code problem;
81 krb5_principal server;
82 krb5_ticket *ticket;
83 int fd, ret;
84 const char *errtxt;
85 Authctxt *authctxt = ssh->authctxt;
86
87 ret = 0;
88 server = NULL;
89 ticket = NULL;
90 reply->length = 0;
91
92 problem = krb5_init(authctxt);
93 if (problem)
94 goto err;
95
96 problem = krb5_auth_con_init(authctxt->krb5_ctx,
97 &authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx);
98 if (problem)
99 goto err;
100
101 fd = ssh_packet_get_connection_in(ssh);
102 problem = krb5_auth_con_setaddrs_from_fd(authctxt->krb5_ctx,
103 authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx, &fd);
104 if (problem)
105 goto err;
106
107 problem = krb5_sname_to_principal(authctxt->krb5_ctx, NULL, NULL,
108 KRB5_NT_SRV_HST, &server);
109 if (problem)
110 goto err;
111
112 problem = krb5_rd_req(authctxt->krb5_ctx, &authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx,
113 auth, server, NULL, NULL, &ticket);
114 if (problem)
115 goto err;
116
117 problem = krb5_copy_principal(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ticket->client,
118 &authctxt->krb5_user);
119 if (problem)
120 goto err;
121
122 /* if client wants mutual auth */
123 problem = krb5_mk_rep(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx,
124 reply);
125 if (problem)
126 goto err;
127
128 /* Check .k5login authorization now. */
129 if (!krb5_kuserok(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_user,
130 authctxt->pw->pw_name))
131 goto err;
132
133 if (client)
134 krb5_unparse_name(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_user,
135 client);
136
137 ret = 1;
138 err:
139 if (server)
140 krb5_free_principal(authctxt->krb5_ctx, server);
141 if (ticket)
142 krb5_free_ticket(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ticket);
143 if (!ret && reply->length) {
144 free(reply->data);
145 memset(reply, 0, sizeof(*reply));
146 }
147
148 if (problem) {
149 errtxt = NULL;
150 if (authctxt->krb5_ctx != NULL)
151 errtxt = krb5_get_error_message(authctxt->krb5_ctx,
152 problem);
153 if (errtxt != NULL) {
154 debug("Kerberos v5 authentication failed: %s", errtxt);
155 krb5_free_error_message(authctxt->krb5_ctx, errtxt);
156 } else
157 debug("Kerberos v5 authentication failed: %d",
158 problem);
159 }
160
161 return (ret);
162}
163
164int
165auth_krb5_tgt(Authctxt *authctxt, krb5_data *tgt)
166{
167 krb5_error_code problem;
168 krb5_ccache ccache = NULL;
169 char *pname;
170 const char *errtxt;
171
172 if (authctxt->pw == NULL || authctxt->krb5_user == NULL)
173 return (0);
174
175 temporarily_use_uid(authctxt->pw);
176
177 problem = krb5_cc_new_unique(authctxt->krb5_ctx, "FILE", NULL, &ccache);
178 if (problem)
179 goto fail;
180
181 problem = krb5_cc_initialize(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ccache,
182 authctxt->krb5_user);
183 if (problem)
184 goto fail;
185
186 problem = krb5_rd_cred2(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx,
187 ccache, tgt);
188 if (problem)
189 goto fail;
190
191 authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache = ccache;
192 ccache = NULL;
193
194 authctxt->krb5_ticket_file = __UNCONST(krb5_cc_get_name(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache));
195
196 problem = krb5_unparse_name(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_user,
197 &pname);
198 if (problem)
199 goto fail;
200
201#ifdef USE_PAM
202 if (options.use_pam)
203 do_pam_putenv(__UNCONST("KRB5CCNAME"), authctxt->krb5_ticket_file);
204#endif
205 debug("Kerberos v5 TGT accepted (%s)", pname);
206
207 restore_uid();
208
209 return (1);
210
211 fail:
212 if (problem) {
213 errtxt = krb5_get_error_message(authctxt->krb5_ctx, problem);
214 if (errtxt != NULL) {
215 debug("Kerberos v5 TGT passing failed: %s", errtxt);
216 krb5_free_error_message(authctxt->krb5_ctx, errtxt);
217 } else
218 debug("Kerberos v5 TGT passing failed: %d", problem);
219 }
220 if (ccache)
221 krb5_cc_destroy(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ccache);
222
223 restore_uid();
224
225 return (0);
226}
227
228
229int
230auth_krb5_password(Authctxt *authctxt, const char *password)
231{
232 krb5_error_code problem;
233 krb5_ccache ccache = NULL;
234 const char *errmsg;
235
236 temporarily_use_uid(authctxt->pw);
237
238 problem = krb5_init(authctxt);
239 if (problem)
240 goto out;
241
242 problem = krb5_parse_name(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->pw->pw_name,
243 &authctxt->krb5_user);
244 if (problem)
245 goto out;
246
247 problem = krb5_cc_new_unique(authctxt->krb5_ctx,
248 krb5_mcc_ops.prefix, NULL, &ccache);
249 if (problem)
250 goto out;
251
252 problem = krb5_cc_initialize(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ccache,
253 authctxt->krb5_user);
254 if (problem)
255 goto out;
256
257 restore_uid();
258
259 problem = krb5_verify_user(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_user,
260 ccache, password, 1, NULL);
261
262 temporarily_use_uid(authctxt->pw);
263
264 if (problem)
265 goto out;
266
267 problem = krb5_cc_new_unique(authctxt->krb5_ctx,
268 krb5_fcc_ops.prefix, NULL, &authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache);
269 if (problem)
270 goto out;
271
272 problem = krb5_cc_copy_cache(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ccache,
273 authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache);
274 krb5_cc_destroy(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ccache);
275 ccache = NULL;
276 if (problem)
277 goto out;
278
279 authctxt->krb5_ticket_file = __UNCONST(krb5_cc_get_name(
280 authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache));
281
282 out:
283 restore_uid();
284
285 if (problem) {
286 if (ccache)
287 krb5_cc_destroy(authctxt->krb5_ctx, ccache);
288
289 if (authctxt->krb5_ctx != NULL) {
290 errmsg = krb5_get_error_message(authctxt->krb5_ctx,
291 problem);
292 debug("Kerberos password authentication failed: %s",
293 errmsg);
294 krb5_free_error_message(authctxt->krb5_ctx, errmsg);
295 } else
296 debug("Kerberos password authentication failed: %d",
297 problem);
298
299 krb5_cleanup_proc(authctxt);
300
301 if (options.kerberos_or_local_passwd)
302 return (-1);
303 else
304 return (0);
305 }
306 return (authctxt->valid ? 1 : 0);
307}
308
309void
310krb5_cleanup_proc(Authctxt *authctxt)
311{
312 debug("krb5_cleanup_proc called");
313 if (authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache) {
314 krb5_cc_destroy(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache);
315 authctxt->krb5_fwd_ccache = NULL;
316 }
317 if (authctxt->krb5_user) {
318 krb5_free_principal(authctxt->krb5_ctx, authctxt->krb5_user);
319 authctxt->krb5_user = NULL;
320 }
321 if (authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx) {
322 krb5_auth_con_free(authctxt->krb5_ctx,
323 authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx);
324 authctxt->krb5_auth_ctx = NULL;
325 }
326 if (authctxt->krb5_ctx) {
327 krb5_free_context(authctxt->krb5_ctx);
328 authctxt->krb5_ctx = NULL;
329 }
330}
331
332#endif /* KRB5 */
